page.title: 13FORESTRY PRACTICE IN FERNESS
page.content: Forestry land is usually unsuitable for farming, but must have good soil and not be too high or exposed. Seeds are sown in nurseries (nearest at Elgin) and planted on hillside at approximately two years old. Trees planted include Scots Pine, Lodgepole Pine, Sitka and Norway spruce. Nowadays, some birch,rowan & alder are also planted. In addition, the Douglas fir is a particularly fast -growing tree. The wood becomes more valuable as the tree ages. Generally,the poorer trees are felled to allow the better ones to grow on to maturity. Plantations are usually fenced for protection against animals which can damage the trees - especially deer,rabbits and hares.
